quote: If there's anything I can do for you    while you're here...
Oh, you've already been helpful.     Just hearing about Dax makes me feel    a little less nervous about the whole    thing...

Really, there's no reason to be    nervous... Jadzia will be a wonderful    host... well, that is, she is a    wonderful host in a Trill manner of    speaking... and I'm sure you'll learn    a great deal from her...
She sounds very different from the    other Dax's I've heard about...
In what fashion?
Let me put it this way -- when I was    told that Jadzia Dax had been    designated my field docent, I asked    for reassignment...
You're joking... why?
Because Dax is known for breaking    initiates...
Breaking them?
I've looked up the records... over    the past two hundred years, Dax has    personally eliminated forty-seven    host candidates from the program...
I suppose it's too late to introduce    myself to her...
Too late?  I doubt it.  Jadzia's a    night owl... Computer, locate    Lieutenant Dax.
Lieutenant Dax is on level seven,    section five...
Ah.  Of course!  Then take us to    level seven, section five...       That's the computer's way of saying    she's in Quark's.

... Over five thousand candidates    qualify for the training program    each year... only three hundred    symbionts are available on the    average.  It doesn't take much for    one of us to get knocked out of    consideration.  The administrators    only want hosts who are...
... the best and the brightest...
QUARK

character: Don't play with my ears unless
quote: you're serious about it...
Jadzia, you have a guest...
Oh.  You're not supposed to be here    until tomorrow.
Yes, Ma'am... I... caught a transport    from Starbase Forty-One a day early...
We found ourselves sitting next to    each other on the way... I've told    Arjin all about you...       Well, not quite all about you...
Do you play Tongo, Arjin?
Ton--tongo?  Nossir.
Then, you'll have to leave, Arjin.     The risk's to you, Lieutenant...
Shame on you, Quark.  Where are your    manners... this is a Trill initiate    you're speaking to.  Of course, he    doesn't play Tongo.
I beg your pardon.
So, we'll have to teach him.
Actually, it is very easy to learn...    how much money did you bring with    you... give the young fellow a seat.       You... out!
It was a very long trip... I think    perhaps...
Of course, you're tired... I'll take    you to your quarters.  Roll me away,    fellas...
You can't roll away now!  You just    won!  You're way ahead of us!  This    isn't fair!
Sore losers.
Yes?
Oh.  I'm sorry.  I thought... this    was Lieutenant Dax's quarters...
She's in the shower.
Oh.  Well.  In that case...
Is she expecting you?
Yes.  My name is Arjin.  She told me    to be here at...
Is that Arjin?
You're early again, Arjin.  We'll    have to work on that...
I can come back...
Don't be silly.  Come in.  Sit down.     I'll only be a minute.  It always    takes me a little longer to get ready    as a female...
I have to go.  I've got to be at    Calondia Four by tomorrow...
When's my rematch?
I'll be back next week.
It was fun.  Brutal but fun.
Safe trip.
The replicator makes a decent citrus    blend...
Thanks, I already had something to    eat.
Would you get me a Black Hole?
A what?
Black Hole.  It's a Ferengi drink.     A bartender I've known for a hundred    years introduced it to Curzon... or    was it Lela... well, it was ages    ago...
Black Hole.
Am I sore.  Did you ever wrestle    Galeo-Manada style, Arjin?
Wrestle... ?
You should.  It's a great way to    start a day.  I'll set you up with    Trajok next week.  He's a great coach.
(I'm ready with the     drink)   O-kay.
Better.
So, you don't play Tongo and you    don't wrestle... what are we going    to do while you're here... ?
I was under the impression that field    training consisted of...
I know all about field training.     Jadzia just went through it a few    years ago...
Yes, Ma'am.
Arjin, if you truly want to become a    Trill host someday, you'll never    call me ma'am again...
Yes -- Lieutenant.
Why don't you just try "Jadzia"...
If you think that's appropriate.
Oh, I'm sure it isn't appropriate at    all.  But then, I hate to be    "appropriate."
Nothing!
Over here, Chief.
All right, come to papa.
Major?
Voles, sir --
Voles?
A Cardassian legacy.
They weren't bothering us until we    started moving into areas of the    station they've been using as hiding    places... now they're spreading out    everywhere...
Apparently they're attracted to    electromagnetic fields.
Give me a hand, will you, Major?
Phasers on stun, Mister O'Brien.  I    want those voles taken alive.
Benjamin, I'd like you to meet Arjin,    the host candidate I told you about.       Commander Benjamin Sisko.
(pointing, continuing     "introductions")   And that's our first officer Major    Kira... Chief Engineer O'Brien...    conducting...       Repairs?
Chasing Cardassian voles.
Really?  I've never seen a Cardassian    Vole.
Be my guest.
So you're the one who picked the    black marble...
Sir?
Field training with Dax used to be    the nightmare of the initiate corps...
That was Curzon...
Gotcha!
Spectacular, isn't it...
Amazing.
Computer, play something by    Frenchotte.
Frenchotte?
Self-exiled Romulan.  I collect    forgotten composers.  Feel like taking    the controls?
I've never flown a Federation runabout    before.
These things practically fly    themselves.  You have third level    flight experience, don't you...
Actually, I just finished fifth level    last month...
Fifth!  I didn't finish the third    level until...
Your last year of training...
How'd you feel when you heard it was    going to be Curzon Dax?
Nauseous might be the best    description.
I suppose it wouldn't be fair to    give me a few tips...
Tips?
On how you managed to impress him.

Let's get one thing straight.  I'm    not Curzon or Lela or any of the    others.  I'm Jadzia Dax.  Jadzia is    only three years older than you are.     You're her first initiate.  To be    honest, in a lot of ways, I still    feel like an initiate myself.  I can    remember the pressure of the    competition when Jadzia was going    through it and I'm not going to make    it difficult for you.  You don't    have to impress me.  Okay?
Okay.
Okay.
So how did you.       Impress him.
I didn't.  Curzon recommended that    my initiate period be terminated.
I've got it!  Engaging manual    stabilizers.
Shutting down all engines.  Computer,    analyze stability loss.
Stability loss was due to an impact    by a subspace interphase pocket...
Nature of interphase pocket...
Unknown.
Damage report...
Starboard nacelle nonfunctional...    maximum available power fifty    percent...
Jadzia... you'd better take a look    at this...
Looks like we snagged something from    that subspace pocket.  Computer,    identify mass on the starboard    nacelle...
Unknown.
Maybe we could create some kind of    EM pathway along the inner hull that    would lure them into a trap...
How can you do that without shutting    down all the other power systems...
I can't... and it would take days to    round them all up... we'd have to    evacuate the station...       The only other thing I've come up    with is a directional sonic    generator...

I can adjust it to a frequency that'll    be uncomfortable to their ears and    drive them out of hiding one at a    time... but at that rate, I'll be    doing it for the rest of my tour of    duty...
It ran right across a Dabo table.
How'd it die?  Get into your food?
As landlords, you're responsible for    this... I expect vermin control or    I'm going to...
Leave?  Please say "leave." I'd trade    you for a Cardassian vole any day.
The girl insists on fighting her    latent attraction to me.       What are you going to do about    these pests, O'Brien...
Relax, Quark... we're trying something    new that ought to make the voles beg    for mercy...
What is it?
A sonic...
Stop!  Stop!
Are you all right?
... What?
Chief, the Mekong just came back    through the wormhole... they're    showing damage...
Open a channel, Major... put them on    the screen...
Are you all right, Dax?
Our power reserves are gone... we    could use a tow.
What happened?
Not exactly sure.  But we picked up    some kind of subspace seaweed on our    starboard nacelle... we couldn't get    rid of it without causing further    damage...
You can cut your engines, Lieutenant.     We'll bring you in to pad "D"...
Set up a containment chamber in the    Science Lab for me, would you Chief?     When we get this thing untangled,
Give us a couple of hours...
Morning'll be fine.  That'll give    Arjin and me a little time to    recoup...
Acknowledged.
Stop by and fill me in later.
Mekong out.
Come on... I'll take you to    dinner...
Ak'la bel-la doo-oo-oo-oo...   Bel-la ak'la doo-oo-oo-oo...   La suhm... La suhm...   L'kahtra... La suhm...
Ak'la bel-la doo-oo-oo-oo!
She taught that to me... can you    believe it... a Klingon song I'd    never heard...
(suffering the     indignity with a     trace of attitude)   She... collects lost composers.
Ak un lach'tel?
Doko... doko... un Koliay Trill...
Don't get any ideas.  She's mine!
You haven't touched your racht.
No, I have.  It's... interesting...
You've been moving it around your    plate to make it look like you've    touched it.
I didn't have to move it... it moved    itself.
(smiles, uncomfortably,     shrugs)   It's all right.  I wasn't very hungry    anyway.
Speak up for yourself while you're    here, okay?
(earnest, but a false     ring)   I'll make a concerted effort.
Who sponsored you for the program?
My father.
Was he Joined?
No, but he always had great ambitions    for his children.  He was a pilot    instructor at the Gedana post for    forty years.  He died last year.
I see where you got your flight    skills...

My sister was always his choice for    Joining... but after she was accepted    into the program, she ran off and    got married.  My father never spoke    to her again.  On the day he died,    he turned to me and said -- "I'm    counting on you"...       His last words to me.
Did he want you to enter Starfleet    after Joining?  Put your flight    training to good use?
Honestly, he couldn't care less what    I did afterwards as long as I became    Joined.  That was his only goal.
And what about your goals?
There are so many possibilities when    you're Joined.  I'm not sure what    I'd do yet... I figure I'd get a lot    of guidance from the symbiont...    wouldn't you say?
The symbiont's influence is very    strong, Arjin... but you're the    host... you've got to be strong enough    to balance that influence with your    own instincts.
If you can't, the symbiont will    overwhelm your personality.
Oh, they are a nuisance, aren't    they...
(who hates to be asking     a Cardassian for     anything)   I was just hoping you'd found some    way to deal with them...
Federation technology isn't up to    the task, eh... ?
Look, I just thought in the interests    of good relations, you might...
You've got the station.  You've got    the voles.  By the way, their mating    season begins in about six weeks...
(barely controlled,     sarcastic)   Thanks for your help.
The Federation could always withdraw    from Bajor...
What's this?
Got me.  It's from Julian.  He called    it the solution you've been looking    for.
"It worked in Hamlin."  Very funny.
Your move.       Your "seaweed" has been safely    transported to the Science Lab...
Did you take a look at it?
What do you think?
We did as much analysis on the    runabout as we could... none of the    matter would scan... we'll do more    tests tomorrow...
How'd your initiate come through the    experience?
(with reservations     attached)   Fine.  He's a good pilot...
Uh oh.
I know that look.
What look.
That look, old man.  The one that    says "this one isn't going to make    it."
Not because of me.
But you have your doubts.
I... have my doubts.
What's his problem?

(picking up steam as     she goes along)   I'm not sure what he brings as a    host... how he'll advance the symbiont    to the next level... frankly,    Benjamin, he's more than a little    arrogant -- okay, for a Trill, that's    to be expected -- but he's riding    his father's ambitions and doesn't    have any idea what he'd do with a    symbiont if he got one.
Have you confronted him?
It's not my job to confront him.
Isn't it?
My job is to show him what it's like    to function as a Joined Trill.  And    that's all.  I can show you the    guidelines.  They're very clear.
Who am I to confront him?
You're Dax.
Yes.  But I'm not Curzon Dax.  And I    won't do to him what Curzon did to    me...
So, what are you going to do?       This kid has to measure up soon or    he'll never be chosen.  True?

So, you're not doing him any favors    by avoiding a confrontation, are    you?       Curzon was tough.  Maybe even abusive    in his own charming way.  But he    always demanded the highest standards    of excellence from these host    candidates...
You don't know what he did to me.
I know that you made it through the    program.
No thanks to him.
Are you sure?

See a glimpse of a vole scurrying in    front of the forcefield... hear a    fritz... the forcefield fails... the    protoplasm drops to the counter and    BREACHES appear in the protoplasm    with bright light pouring out... the    BREACHES tear open wider and the    light spills out consuming the    protoplasm...
Voles ate through the security field    energy lines...
So, nothing is secure on this station    any more...
Any reason to believe there's an    imminent threat from this?
Not as far as I can tell.  But I    can't tell you a lot yet.

I want to know what we're dealing    with as soon as possible.  I'll    schedule a briefing for fourteen    hundred hours...    (Dax acknowledges,     continuing to O'Brien     as they EXIT)   And take those phasers off stun,    Chief.  No more Mister Nice Guy.
How's your astrophysics profile,    Arjin...
It's one of my better subjects.     Maybe that's why they sent me to    work with you...
Set up a gravimetric microprobe for    me... I need to calibrate the energy    profile...
Jadzia... I felt that... last night...    maybe I didn't express myself well...    about my own goals...
I think you expressed yourself very    clearly.
I just didn't want you to think I    hadn't set any goals for post-   Joining... I have thought about    Starfleet... with my flight    training... it would be a perfect...
(low key interruption,     as she works)   Starfleet is a career... a pilot is    a job... what does that have to do    with being Joined...
I'm not sure I understand.
(not harsh, always     working)   No, I don't think you do.
(beat, suddenly on     the defensive: what's     that supposed to     mean?)   I'm sorry?
I think you're telling me what I    want to hear.
(smiles, incredulous,     she's changing the     rules on me)   That's not true.
I think you went to your quarters    last night... tossed and turned in    bed because you knew some of the    things you'd said concerned me...    and now you're trying to fix it.
I'm... I'm just trying to... to    clarify...
I know what it's like.  I've tossed    and turned myself.  Please don't    insult me by denying it.
I'm finished.
Let's run a phase variant analysis...
I'm worried about you, Arjin.
Worried?
(tough for her, said     calmly, in measured     phrases)   I'm worried you're not preparing    yourself to be joined.
That's it?  A day and a half and    you've made up your mind...
I didn't say that.
Look, you've gotten this far by    anticipating every demand of the    program and performing beyond    everyone's expectations, am I right?
I'd like to think that's true.
And I'm telling you that from this    point on -- that's not going to be    good enough.
Highly structured but it doesn't    seem to conform to any of our physical    laws... computer, run a spectral    line profile analysis...
Spectral analysis will take    approximately seven minutes.
Just to... "speak up for myself"...    I have to say I'm feeling... a little    betrayed... here... I mean, after    your impassioned "I-am-Jadzia, fellow    initiate" speech in the runabout...

I understand why you feel that way.     But this isn't about me.  This is    about the standards for Trill hosts.     The opportunity is too rare and too    important to waste on the wrong    candidate.
And in your mind, I'm a wrong    candidate.
I don't know that yet.  But I felt    it only... fair... to tell you that    I am... worried about you.
I see.
I should have known this... I should    have realized this... you're Dax.       Standards for Trill hosts?

That's really incredible coming from    you.  Because I've never seen any    host in my life who is as far below    those standards as you are... ma'am.     No wonder Curzon Dax tried to    terminate your training.
I was finally able to read the EM    flux... there are high plasma    concentrations... and a rapidly    expanding mass...
How rapidly...

(anticipating the     security implications)   The energy buildup is already    straining the containment chamber.     But here's the kicker: the mass    periodically undergoes phased    expansion and grows in spurts...    it's a very specific growth pattern    that the computer recognized...
Recognized as what?
The expansion patterns of a universe.
What?
A universe?
What we have here, Benjamin, is a    proto-universe in its earliest stages    of formation.  Unfortunately, as it    grows, it's displacing our own    universe.
Can we get it back where it came    from?

This is not the subspace "seaweed"    we started with.  This is an energy    mass with properties that don't    conform to our own laws of nature.     I have no idea what might happen if    we tried to move it, let alone take    it back into the wormhole.  Even if    we get there, the wormhole's vertiron    nodes could interact with the energy    fluctuations of the proto-universe    and cause a devastating reaction.     It could threaten this whole system.
And if we don't do anything, it'll    eventually obliterate this system    and beyond...
Can't we contain it somehow...
Not without destroying it.
Under these circumstances, that sounds    like a pretty good option to me.
We can create a forcefield that will    contain it... if we suppress it long    enough, the feedback pressure should    create an implosive wave.  It would    self-destruct.
How long before the next phase of    expansion?
About three hours.  The collateral    shock waves will probably destroy    the lab...
Can we get this containment field    ready by then?
Yessir.
Have Odo evacuate section fourteen.
Another?
Keep pouring until I drown.
Sounds pretty serious.
Serious?  No.  I just threw my whole    life out a porthole.  Nothing serious.
There isn't a problem in the world    that can't be fixed by the right    holosuite program.
(ignoring that, into     his own thing)   Never trust a Trill, Quark.
Why not?
They're... two-faced.
Does that go for all Trills or just    for the ones with the worm?
Any worm named Dax.
She break your heart, son?
What?
Mine too.  And Bashir's in here every    other day crying in his synthale    over her.  The Promenade is littered    with the bodies of the men she's...
It wasn't my heart she broke.  It    was me.  My career.  My life.
Wait a minute -- is this about all    that "initiate" stuff?
She told me I "wasn't preparing myself    to Join."
With the worm?  So, that's her    opinion.  What's that worth, anyhow?
A bad recommendation from your field    docent and you can forget it.

Listen, son.  When I was a young    man, no older than you, I had an    apprentice position with the District    Sub-Nagus.  I licked his boots like    you couldn't believe.  He loved me.     I was his golden boy... I was on a    fast track to the top of the Ferengi    business world... and then it all    fell apart...
How?
Rule of Acquisition One-twelve.
"Never have sex with the boss's    sister." I was fired, broke.  It was    quite a setback to my ambitions.
How'd you recover?

Never did.  Look at me -- tending    bar out here in Wormhole Junction    while the big boys fly past me at    warp speed.  You only get one shot    at the latinum stairway and if you    miss it, you miss it.  Welcome to    the club, son.
Thanks.
Glad I could help.
Computer, confirm the localized    entropy decrease in the energy mass.
Confirmed.
How much have the readings decreased    in the last hour?
This can't be right.  The whole    thermodynamic structure would have    to be changing.
Activate a quantometer probe.
Verify filter calibration.
Filter calibration verified.
Set energy flux resolution to point    one microdyne.
Begin high resolution energy scans.
There could be a malfunction in the    sensors... computer, run a self-   diagnostic and check quantometer    calibration.
Calibration is locked and normal.     Diagnostic underway.
Are there any feedback anomalies in    the dynametric array?
Negative.
What's the feedback reading?
Feedback reading is zero.    (beat, several computer     bleeps)   Diagnostic complete.  Sensors are    functioning normally.
Odo to Sisko...
Yes, Odo...
Section fourteen has been evacuated.
Acknowledged.  Mister O'Brien... ?
Just finishing up, Commander...
Sisko to Dax.  We're preparing to    establish the containment field...    I'd like you out of the lab during    this...
I'm already out, Benjamin... but I'm    not sure you're going to want to do    this now...
Why not?
I've found indications of life in    the proto-universe.
... non-random thermodynamics...       ... irregular power consumption.  The    computer's confirmed it, these are    lifesigns...
Wait a minute... single cell microbes    are lifeforms too... but Doctor Bashir    has a hypospray that will kill them...    to say nothing of the Voles...
Kira, we could very well be dealing    with intelligent life.
How is that possible... you told us    this proto-universe was just formed...

Oh, it's quite possible.  We may    have only experienced hours since    this universe was formed... but we    have no way of knowing how fast time    is moving for them.  Theoretically,    billions of years might have passed...
An entire evolution of a species    might have taken place in the last    few hours.
It's possible.
O'Brien to Sisko
Go ahead, Chief.
Commander, if we're going to implement    that containment field, we've got to    do it now.  In two minutes, this    thing is going to expand...
Get your people out of there, Chief.     We're not going to put up the    containment field...
Aye, sir.
Commander, this is only going to    delay the inevitable...
Take us to yellow alert, Major.     Move repair crews into position...
Warning.  Hull Breach.  Level Twenty-   two, Section Fourteen.
Sisko to O'Brien.  Seal off Section    Fourteen, move your repair crews    in...
Aye, sir...
How long before the next expansion...
Roughly five hours...
How much will it expand?
About three hundred percent.  We'd    lose a whole section of the station.     By tomorrow, the station will be    gone.
We could beam it into space, give us    some more time to come up with a    solution.
We already have a solution and the    longer we wait the harder it will be    to implement it.  I'm sorry but this    is us or them.  We have to destroy    it.
You can't just wipe out a    civilization... we would be committing    mass murder.
(can't anyone see     this but me?)   It's like stepping on ants, Odo.
I don't step on ants, Major.       Just because we don't understand a    lifeform doesn't mean we can destroy    it.
Do you have a better idea?  Does    anyone?
I'll give you my decision in an hour.
Personal log.  Supplemental.  One    hour.  One hour to make a decision    that could mean the life or death of    a civilization.  Or the end to our    own.

My mind keeps going back to the    Borg... how I despised their...    indifference as they tried to    exterminate us.  And I have to ask    myself... would I be any different    if I destroyed another universe to    preserve my own?
Hey.
Hi, Dad.  What're you doing back so    early?
Just wanted to see you.
He told you, didn't he.
Told me what.
Chief O'Brien.  Darn it, he promised.
If you have something you want to    tell me, let's hear it.
I love her, Dad.
Okay.
She's everything I ever wanted in a    woman.
I'm sure she's a wonderful girl...
She's not a girl... she's a woman...    she doesn't like to be called a    girl... everybody calls her that and    she hates it... she wants to be    something better than that...
Than what... ?
Than a Dabo girl.
You're in love with a Dabo girl?
Wait a minute, you said Chief O'Brien    told you...
No, I didn't.  Who is she... how old    is she, Jake...
Oh, jeez...       I wanted to tell you, but I was sure    you'd never understand...
So now you're hiding things from    me...
You would have understood?
Of course not!
It's Mardah, isn't it... the one    you've been tutoring in entomology.
I really want you to meet her, Dad.
I really want to meet her.
Can I invite her to dinner tonight?
(beat, as the real     problems he's facing     are reawakened)   Not tonight.  But soon.
Thanks, Dad.  You'll love her.
What's so interesting in there?
I can see my future.
I wouldn't trust a bottle of synthale    to tell you the future.
Let's get this over with, okay?     Just use a sharp blade so I won't    feel it.

You don't know me as well as you    think you do.  I'm sure you looked    at all the training profiles... but    that doesn't tell you who Jadzia    really was before she was joined.     Let me tell you about her.  Jadzia    was the quietest, shyest, most    withdrawn young woman you've ever    known.  Brilliant, top grades... and    not a clue to what life was about.     She hadn't lived outside the program.     And it didn't matter because she was    sailing through... until she met    Curzon Dax.  Curzon sized her up in    twenty seconds... and made the next    two weeks the most miserable of her    life.  She cried herself to sleep    every night.  She hated him for it.     But after the field training was    over and she learned about his    recommendation to terminate her from    the program... she went back a    different woman.  She found her voice    and reapplied.  She tore through the    program with a passion, a vengeance.     And in the end, the administrators    chose her for Joining.
How did you wind up with the Dax    symbiont?
When I learned Curzon was dying, I    requested the Dax symbiont.
And Curzon didn't object?
No.  And I've never been sure why...    except as I've come to know Curzon's    dark sense of humor... I have a    feeling the irony might have appealed    to him.

Jadzia Dax is not Curzon Dax... but    I am Dax... and I'm slowly coming to    terms with what that means.  Sometimes    it means gambling or wrestling.     Sometimes it means waking up an    initiate before he slides into the    middle of the pack and gets    overlooked.
You're giving me another chance?

You're the only one who can give    yourself another chance.  You can't    simply do this anymore to meet other    people's expectations... not your    father's, not your teachers', not    mine.  You've got to discover what    Arjin wants... out of life and out    of Joining.
We'll try to take it back through    the wormhole... How soon can you be    ready?
I'd want to be sure we have a    containment field that would block    out the vertiron node radiation as    we pass through it... maybe two    hours...
Better get started.
Wouldn't hurt to have a level five    pilot along.
Chief... ?
The containment field is in place    and holding, sir... but I'd like to    run a practical test on the vertiron    integrity...
"Like to" or "need to"... that thing    expands again in a little over an    hour...
This is the strongest forcefield I    know how to construct, sir... but a    test would at least tell us our odds    of getting it through the wormhole    intact...
I'm not playing the odds today.     Sisko to Rio Grande... your status...
Systems check complete... auxiliary    power to shields... I'd say we're    packed and ready, Benjamin...
Ready transporter.
Locking on to the containment    field...
Energize...
Chief... we're getting a phase    variation here...
Stand by.  The energy fluctuations    are driving the transporter crazy.
We've got it now.
Switching your transporter to secure    mode.  Readings are stable.
When you're ready, Dax.
Take us out gently, Arjin.
Firing thrusters.
Energy readings from the containment    field are holding...
